entry.title: Drain Man Sentenced for Firearm Manufacturing Convictions
entry.summary: A Drain man was sentenced for illegally manufacturing firearms with a 3D printer. David Ralston, 35, pleaded guilty to three felony counts. He received probation, jail time served, and forfeited multiple firearms and parts.

entry.title: Police Seize Dogs, Firearms in Roseburg Animal Neglect Case
entry.summary: Roseburg police seized 16 dogs, firearms, and ammunition after an investigation into an alleged illegal breeding operation. A 66-year-old man faces 17 counts of animal neglect and firearm charges following the Aug. 18 incident.

entry.title: Coos Bay Driver Pleads Guilty in UCC Softball Bus Crash
entry.summary: Jonathan Dowdy of Coos Bay pleaded guilty to multiple charges in the April crash that killed UCC coach Jami Strinz and player Kiley Jones and injured eight others. Several counts were dismissed in a plea deal. Sentencing in Coquille is set for Sept. 11.

entry.title: Winston Council Passes Marijuana Facility Ordinance, Tables RV Park Stay Limits
entry.summary: The Winston City Council tabled a proposal to limit RV park stays and advanced Ordinance 75-724, which includes zoning and animal code updates and would allow recreational marijuana facilities in the city. The measure proceeds to further review and public input.

entry.title: UCC Begins Work on Welcome Center and Medical Careers Hub
entry.summary: Umpqua Community College has begun building a $21.5 million Welcome Center and Medical Careers Hub. Opening in early 2027, it will centralize student services and expand medical training, backed by an $8 million state match and support from local partners.

entry.summary: SUTHERLIN — Ramona Briggs brought her 1959 Chevy El Camino to the Sutherlin Blackberry Festival car show Saturday, displaying the red vintage vehicle in the grass in Sutherlin’s Central Park.

entry.summary: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop

entry.title: ROSEBURG RECEIVES MOST MEASURABLE RAINFALL SINCE MAY
entry.summary: August 18, 2025 6:30 a.m. Roseburg received the most measurable rainfall on a day since May, on Saturday. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that the Roseburg Regional Airport measured 0.13 inches of rain. That was the biggest amount of rain since May 12th, when...

entry.title: SUPPRESSION EFFORTS CONTINUE ON HISTORIC DOERNER TREE FIRE
entry.summary: August 18, 2025 4:10 a.m. Firefighters from the Coos Forest Protective Association are actively engaged in suppression efforts on the Doerner Fir Tree fire. The historic tree, located east of Coquille on Bureau of Land Management land, was displaying active flames on the top and burning down a portion of the trunk. Multiple engines and...

entry.title: SCHOLFIELD FIRE REMAINS AT 50 ACRES NOW 43 PERCENT CONTAINED
entry.summary: August 18, 2025 4:00 a.m. Covering coastal Douglas County: The Scholfield Fire remains at 50 acres and is now 43 percent contained. An update from the Coos Forest Protective Association said the fire, located southeast of Reedsport, received measurable rain on Saturday. Sunday crews were able to regain access on the dirt roads and continued...

entry.title: SCENIC FIRE REMAINS AT 49 ACRES AND 80 PERCENT CONTAINED
entry.summary: August 18, 2025 3:50 a.m. The Scenic Fire on the High Cascades Ranger District remains at 49 acres and 80 percent contained. An update from the Rogue River Siskiyou National Forest said the fire, located near National Creek east of Highway 230, received some precipitation on Saturday, aiding resources in mop up efforts. Firefighters have...

entry.title: HOYLE ANNOUNCES OVER $16.6 MILLION FOR 15 COMMUNITY PROJECTS
entry.summary: August 18, 2025 3:40 a.m. U.S. Representative Val Hoyle has announced that she recently secured $16.625 million in Community Project Funding from the federal government for projects across Oregon’s 4th district. A release said the funding, which would become available if Congress passes full-year appropriations bills, would be awarded in varying amounts to 15 towns,...

entry.title: SPECIAL TRAFFIC ENFORCEMENT PATROLS THROUGH SEPTEMBER
entry.summary: August 18, 2025 3:30 a.m. For the remaining days of August, through the end of September, the Roseburg Police Department has some extra patrols out working traffic enforcement, with a specific focus on safety belt use, distracted driving, speeding, and driving under the influence. An RPD release said the focused patrols are made possible due...

entry.title: ROSEBURG LIBRARY’S SUMMER READING PROGRAM
entry.summary: August 18, 2025 3:20 a.m. Roseburg Public Library’s Summer Reading Program is drawing to a close. A city release said all participants must submit their reading logs and book reviews by 2:00 p.m. on Saturday, August 23rd to be eligible for prizes. The library also is in the final week of programs for the summer....

entry.title: SMART READING SEEKS SITE COORDINATORS IN DOUGLAS COUNTY
entry.summary: August 18, 2025 3:05 a.m. SMART Reading, a statewide program that helps Oregon’s youngest readers build confidence and literary skills. is currently seeking site coordinators to help its work in Douglas County. Site coordinators lead the program at each school site, organizing volunteers, building relationships with school staff, putting together reading sessions, and helping ensure...

entry.title: CAMP MILLENNIUM HAS BINGO NIGHT FUNDRAISER AUGUST 30TH
entry.summary: August 18, 2025 2:50 a.m. Camp Millennium has a Bingo Night fundraiser coming up on Saturday, August 30th. The event will be held at the Buckaroo Barn, on Northeast Stephens Street in the Winchester area. It will take place from 1:00 p.m. to 4:00 p.m. with the doors opening at 12:30 p.m. A $25 ticket...
